report_title: Industry Report on Apartment Rental Market
executive_summary: The apartment rental industry has seen revenue growth over the past five years to 2024, driven by favorable economic conditions and demographic trends that increased demand. COVID-19 temporarily reduced demand in 2020-2021, but revenue has rebounded since 2022 due to higher prices and strong rental market. Revenue grew at 2.1% CAGR over the past five years and is expected to reach $282.3 billion by end of 2024, including 1.0% growth in 2024.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Growing cities benefit lessors as consumers spend more on rent
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The largest revenue share comes from urban centers where rental apartments are prevalent due to density and demographics.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Rising interest rates put homeownership out of reach
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Homeownership is preferred long-term, but rising interest rates from the Federal Reserve's 11 rate hikes between March 2022 and January 2024 made mortgages more expensive.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Rental supply to increase then taper off
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: US apartment supply hit a record in 2023 and 2024 will also be high, but construction has slowed due to factors like insufficient debt and increased costs.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Interest rate cuts will impact the industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The Federal Reserve expects to cut interest rates three times in 2024 as inflation eases.

industry_definition: The apartment rental industry consists of operators that act as lessors of residential buildings used as dwellings.

positive_impact_factors: High and steady industry assistance level

key_trends: Competition is strongest at the top end of the industry for luxury apartments
Rising property values benefit lessors but raise affordability concerns

market_segmentation.segment_description: This segment accounts for single-person apartments' share of all occupied rental units in the US.
This segment accounts for two person apartments' share of all occupied rental units in the US.
This segment accounts for three-or-more-person apartments' share of all occupied units in the US.

products_and_services.product_description: This segment accounts for single-unit structures' share of total rental structures in the US.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Rental of Two- to Four-Unit Structures
products_and_services.product_description: Accounted for in this segment, smaller complexes and townhouses consisting of nine or fewer units have long been staples of cities in the United States.
Accounted for in this segment, larger complexes consisting of 10 or more units provide the obvious benefit of having a greater number of units, so lessors can generate more revenue in less space.

tier_2_suppliers: Electric Power Transmission in the US
Woodworking Machinery Manufacturing in the US
Construction Machinery Manufacturing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Apartment & Condominium Construction in the US
Water Supply & Irrigation Systems in the US
tier_2_buyers: Real Estate Sales & Brokerage in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The rental vacancy rate is a key metric for apartment lessors as it is the best indicator of supply and demand.

business_locations.location_description: The Mid-Atlantic is home to some major cities, but New York stands clearly above the rest.
Cities in regions including the Southeast and West tend to be more spread out.

regulations_points.regulation_title: BUILDING CODES AND OTHER REGULATIONS ENSURE TENANTS HAVE A SAFE PLACE TO SLEEP
regulations_points.regulation_description: Compliance with building codes and other safety regulations is required to operate an apartment building.

regulations_points.regulation_title: ZONING AND RENT RATE LIMITS KEEP LESSORS IN CHECK
regulations_points.regulation_description: Zoning restrictions and rate limits protect renters.

barriers_points.barrier_description: New apartment lessors contend with substantial legal barriers.

basis_points.basis_title: Competition strongest at top end of industry
basis_points.basis_description: Competition is strongest at the top end of the industry.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Top lessors generate high profit but small market share
concentration_points.concentration_description: While the large luxury apartment complexes may be the most successful, the apartment rental market is massive.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Administrative Costs Add Up for Lessors
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Costs connected to the operation of a rental facility are an essential part of operating a successful apartment complex.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Entrance into the apartment rental industry comes with significant capital expense.

volatility_points.volatility_title: The job market and interest rates influence volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: Interest rate fluctuations significantly impact both renters and buyers.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Tech-driven experiences are becoming more prevalent
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Virtual tours allow potential tenants to explore apartments remotely.

FAQs.question: Do your sales depend on the overall health of the US economy at large?
FAQs.answer: Demand for apartment rentals will follow trends in consumer affordability.
